docs.snippet: BEVERLY SMITH and her husband talked about taking a trip to Florida this winter to get away from the frosty weather in Winnipeg. But it did not take them long to decide to spend a few weeks in Cuba instead.    ''Our daughter had been there and sai...
docs.lead_paragraph: BEVERLY SMITH and her husband talked about taking a trip to Florida this winter to get away from the frosty weather in Winnipeg. But it did not take them long to decide to spend a few weeks in Cuba instead. ''Our daughter had been there and said it was great,'' said Mrs. Smith, 66, a retired special-education teacher. ''And by the way, we got a sale, which helped quite a lot.''

docs.snippet: BERLIN, March 24 -- The familiar totalitarian build-up in the German press gives strong indications that the Russians are planning to close the frontier between the Eastern and Western zones. As a result of the general recognition of the apparent ...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, March 24 -- The familiar totalitarian build-up in the German press gives strong indications that the Russians are planning to close the frontier between the Eastern and Western zones. As a result of the general recognition of the apparent maneuver the Soviet general in charge of transportation gave the Communist news service late today an interview that could be interpreted as a denial but which had the journalists here frankly puzzled.
docs.abstract: USSR plan to close interzonal borders hinted

docs.snippet: Senator Styles Bridges, chairman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, declared here yesterday before leaving for Europe with five other committee members that the Soviet Union's refusal to grant visas to them and other Government officials who ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Styles Bridges, chairman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, declared here yesterday before leaving for Europe with five other committee members that the Soviet Union's refusal to grant visas to them and other Government officials who wished to enter Russia to inspect the American Embassy at Moscow was a "glaring example" of "high-handedness."
docs.abstract: Bridges and 5 other Sens leave for Eur; 2 members of subcom on immigration leave for Eur

headline.main: BRIDGES CONDEMNS SOVIET VISA BAN; Refusal to Permit Senators to Visit Cited as Example of 'High-Handedness'

docs.snippet: Britain's Border Agency plans to challenge a court ruling that would admit the hip-hop star Snoop Dogg into the country, The Associated Press reported. He was barred from Britain after his arrest with five others in 2006 at Heathrow Airport in Lon...
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Border Agency plans to challenge a court ruling that would admit the hip-hop star Snoop Dogg into the country, The Associated Press reported. He was barred from Britain after his arrest with five others in 2006 at Heathrow Airport in London on charges of violent disorder in an incident that injured seven officers. But Snoop Dogg, above right, whose real name is Calvin Broadus, appealed, and in January an asylum and immigration tribunal granted him clearance to enter. Last year he was forced to cancel a tour of Britain with Sean Combs after he was refused a visa.
docs.abstract: Britain's Border Agency plans to challenge court ruling that would admit hip-hop star Snoop Dogg into country; photo (S)

headline.main: British Agency Renews Its Battle To Ban Snoop
